more_content:
Introducing: 100 Things to Do This Summer in New York City

Sure, there are more than that, but you want the best. We’re here to help you find the best ways to spend your time in New York City. So we’ll be posting here on our blog over the coming months letting you know about upcoming events, shows, festivals, and opportunities in the city this summer.

Sometimes the most colorful and fun events in the New York City can’t be easily categorized.

But that won’t stop us from trying. And it shouldn’t stop you from seizing the opportunity to try something different. Be spontaneous. Improvise a little. Dive into the deep end.

So, what are you in the mood for? Comedy? A relaxing garden stroll? A fantastically idiosyncratic and personality-filled festival of mermaid mythology?

Hey, it’s New York City, so you’re in luck. We have all of the above. Even the mermaids.

Del Close Marathon Improv Festival

Just three blocks from The Evelyn, the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater is home base for this year’s Del Close Marathon Improv Festival. The festival consists of nearly 600 improv events throughout one weekend at various venues across the five boroughs. Laugh until you cry as the best improv comedians from all over the country deliver hilariously unpredictable performances.

When: Jun 23 - 25, 2017 

Where: Upright Citizens Brigade Theater

Getting there: It’s a quick, three-block walk west of The Evelyn.

The Mermaid Parade

The nation's largest art parade, Coney Island USA’s Mermaid Parade is an eclectic celebration of ancient mythology and honky-tonk rituals of the seaside. Witness the creativity of more than 3,000 people in a parade that has become a staple of Coney Island culture. The Mermaid Parade was created by artists to bring mythology to life and features participants dressed in hand-made costumes. It’s a great introduction to life and creativity of Coney Island.

When: Saturday, June 17, 2017, 1 p.m.

Where: The Parade will start at West 21st Street and Surf Avenue.

Getting there: Coney Island is about a 40-minute ride south of The Evelyn.

Rose Garden Weekend

Thousands of breathtaking roses of every variety, shape, and color await you at the Peggy Rockefeller Rose Garden. Rose Garden Weekend is a two-day celebration of Nature’s beauty, featuring live music, plant care demonstrations, tours with expert rosarians, and refreshments in the shade of the garden’s overlooks. Take in the sights and smells of this historic rose collection while enjoying the peaceful melodies of live harp and cello performances. Refreshments, including wine and beer will also be available on site, so you’ll be able to take your time and make an afternoon or full day of this one-of-a-kind experience.

When: June 3 - 4, 2017, 10 a.m. - 6 p.m.

Where: New York Botanical Garden

Getting there: From The Evelyn, it’s about a 30-minute drive north.

And after you’ve experienced the incredible summer events that NYC has to offer, wake up on the right side of the bed and begin your day with a $50 credit towards breakfast at our partner restaurant, Tarallucci E Vino-Nomad.
